Question 46.Question: In Nigeria, military regimes returned power to civilian through
Question 46.Explanation: During the military rule in Nigeria, there were transition programmes which were successful while some were not. While General Gowon was in power, he announced a nine – point transition programme but he reneged on his promise. Before the death of Muritala Mohammed, he announced a four – year political transition programme which was later executed by his second – in – command, Gen. Olusegun Obasanjo. Also, during the military rule of Abubakar, a new transition programme which set May 29, 1999 as the hand – over date of power to an elected civilian president was announced. On the proposed date, civilian government was restored to Nigeria and military rule ended till date.
